Areas present in angular gyrus is Brodmann Area 39. It is associated with processes like reading, writing, and language comprehension. It also plays a role in the integration of visual, auditory, and somatosensory information, contributing to our ability to understand and interpret the world around us.

 

Option D. Postcentral Gyrus: The postcentral gyrus is located in the parietal lobe and is primarily associated with sensory functions, particularly somatosensory processing. It is not directly involved in speech production or language processing. Brodmann Area 3, 1, and 2 (Primary Somatosensory Cortex): These areas together make up the primary somatosensory cortex, which is located in the postcentral gyrus. It is responsible for our ability to perceive sensations such as touch, pressure, temperature, and proprioception (awareness of body position).

 

Educational Objective:

 

Broca's area is situated in the inferior frontal gyrus.

 

  • Broca's motor speech area - (44,45) is located in the inferior frontal gyrus.
  • Wernicke's area - (22) is located in the superior temporal gyrus.

questions.text: Which among the following is not true according to case-control study? (FMGE Jan 2024)
questions.solution:
Ans. D) Cause to effect design

 

Explanation:

 

A case-control study is a retrospective study that looks backward in time, starting with the outcome (disease) and then investigating potential exposures or risk factors that may have contributed to the disease. It is an effect-to-cause study design. Case-control studies are particularly useful for studying rare diseases, as they allow researchers to identify a sufficient number of cases without requiring a large cohort.

 

Due to the retrospective nature of the study, incidence rates cannot be calculated directly. Instead, the strength of the association between exposure and outcome is measured using the odds ratio, which is calculated using the formula –

 

2 × 2 table

 

 

Odds Ratio (Cross Product Ratio) = ad/bc

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. "Effect to cause design" is a true statement about case-control studies, as they start with the disease (effect) and work backwards to identify potential causes (exposures).

 

Option B. "Used to study Rare Disease" is also a true statement. Case-control studies are well-suited for investigating rare diseases because they allow researchers to identify a sufficient number of cases without requiring a large cohort, which would be impractical and costly.

 

Option C. "Odds ratio can be calculated" is correct. In case-control studies, the incidence rate cannot be directly calculated, so the strength of the association between exposure and outcome is measured using the odds ratio.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Case-control studies are retrospective, effect-to-cause study designs that are particularly useful for investigating rare diseases and calculating odds ratios to measure the strength of association between exposures and outcomes.

questions.text: Where is use of this instrument contra-indicated? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Obstructed labor

 

  • This image shows an obstetric forceps. 
  • Forceps are contraindicated in obstructed labor because attempting instrumental delivery in this condition would be dangerous and fatal. In obstructed labor, the fetus cannot descend through the birth canal due to mechanical obstruction, making it a direct indication for cesarean section. Any attempt at instrumental delivery could cause serious maternal and fetal trauma.

 

Other Options: 

 

Option A. Cesarean section: Incorrect. Forceps can be used during cesarean section, especially with a mobile free-floating head. For deeply engaged heads, one blade of the forceps can be used to dislodge the head.

 

Option B. After coming head of breech: Incorrect. Piper's forceps are specifically designed and commonly used for delivering the after-coming head in breech deliveries.

 

Option D. Occipito posterior: Incorrect. Forceps can be safely used in occipito posterior position. The baby will be delivered face-to-pubis, but both forceps and vacuum extraction are acceptable options.

 

Educational Objective: 

 

Obstructed labor is an absolute contraindication for instrumental delivery (both forceps and vacuum) and is a direct indication for cesarean section.

questions.text: Given below is the image of a 33-hour chick embryo. Which of the following is derived from the marked structure? (INICET Nov 2023)
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Ribs

 

 

 

  • The marked structure in the image is the para-axial mesoderm. In the 33-hour chick embryo, the para-axial mesoderm is situated on each side of the neural tube and notochord. This mesoderm divides into segments known as somites. Somites further differentiate into sclerotome, myotome, and dermatome.
  • The sclerotome, derived from the somites, gives rise to the vertebrae and ribs. The para-axial mesoderm is responsible for forming these segmented structures, essential components of the axial skeleton.

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Kidney: Incorrect. The kidney is derived from the intermediate mesoderm, not the para-axial mesoderm.

 

Option B. Dorsal root ganglion: Incorrect. The dorsal root ganglion is derived from neural crest cells, which are separate from the para-axial mesoderm.

 

Option C. Parietal pleura: Incorrect. The parietal pleura is derived from the lateral plate mesoderm, not the para-axial mesoderm.

 

Educational Objective:

 

  • The para-axial mesoderm forms somites, which give rise to the vertebrae and ribs.
